shellshocker

Class Barrel

  • java.lang.Object
    • shellshocker.Barrel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Rotatable

    public class Barrel
extends java.lang.Object
implements Rotatable
    Implements the rotating barrel that is directed by the mouse of the user and can be used to direct the user's attacks.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Barrel(Flamethrower f, Ragnar r)
      Assigns updated variable names to the specified variables.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calculateRotate()
      Calculates the amount that the barrel must rotate in order to match the position of the mouse.
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics window)
      Draws the barrel of the user-controlled character. The barrel will rotate according to the position of the mouse.
      double getDrawX()
      Returns the x-coordinate of the location at which the rotated image is drawn.
      double getDrawY()
      Returns the y-coordinate of the location at which the rotated image is drawn.
      double getXPos()
      Returns the x-coordinate of the location of the base of the barrel.
      double getYPos()
      Returns the y-coordinate of the location of the base of the barrel.
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage rotateImage(double rotationRequired)
      Transforms the basic image of the barrel into a rotated image of the barrel.
      void setDrawX(double x)
      Sets the drawing x-coordinate equal to the passed parameter.
      void setDrawY(double y)
      Sets the drawing y-coordinate equal to the passed parameter.
      void setXPos(double x)
      Sets the base x-coordinate equal to the passed parameter.
      void setYPos(double y)
      Sets the base y-coordinate equal to the passed parameter.
      void update(int mousex, int mousey, int basx, int basy)
      Updates the variable names of the specified variables for later use.

      • update

        public void update(int mousex,
          int mousey,
          int basx,
          int basy)
        Updates the variable names of the specified variables for later use.
        Parameters:
        mousex - the x-coordinates of the mouse.
        mousey - the y-coordinates of the mouse.
        basx - the x-coordinates of the barrel at its position.
        basy - the x-coordinates of the barrel at its basic position.
